Voila Hotel & Flying Dodo, Bagatelle

What's up for 2018?

Innovation. Technology. Community.

After the success of previous years the Mauritius Software Craftsmanship Community (MSCC) is organising the fourth edition of the Developers Conference in partnership with a number of local and international companies. Although the MSCC was founded back in 2013 it quickly became clear that our tropical island has a certain lack of informational and technical events. During some monthly meetups we spoke about this situation and that it would be very interesting and delightful to organise such an event.

As previously, the event is a free of charge, community-driven, three-days IT tech conference hosted annually in Mauritius. Itâs an event full of business opportunities and professional networking. Attendees can learn about latest software development technologies, methodologies, as well as cloud features and infrastructure.

The aim of the conference is to provide local software developers a buffet of tools, practices and principles applicable to tackling current challenges in the Mauritian software development environment. From keeping up to date with the latest technologies and trends to tackling the challenges of working in large enterprise systems â itâs a buffet of experiences, ideas and pragmatic advice as well as an opportunity to connect with peers across the industry.
